etymology.description: 口(口) (kǒu, "enclosure") + 畇(畇) (yún, a variant of "even field") = enclosure for even fields -> storing grains
etymology.interpretation: The character 囷(jùn) combines the idea of an enclosure 口(口) (kǒu, "enclosure") with 畇(畇), which represents fertile, well-cultivated fields. This suggests a storage area where the harvest from such fields is kept.

examples.chinese: 秋收开始后(秋收開始後)，农民忙着囷粮(農民忙著囷糧)。
examples.pinyin: Qiū shōu kāishǐ hòu, nóngmín mángzhe jùn liáng.
examples.english: After the autumn harvest began, the farmers busily stored grain.

examples.chinese: 仓库里囷满了谷子(倉庫裡囷滿了穀子)。
examples.english: The warehouse was filled with stored grain.

examples.chinese: 古人曾用囷储存五谷(古人曾用囷儲存五穀)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔrén céng yòng jùn chǔcún wǔ gǔ.
examples.english: The ancients once used it to store the five grains.
